summary:
Laura Bailey interrupting the stream to demand snacks is my aesthetic. 
The list, off the top of my head, includes:
donuts
cake...
body:
Laura Bailey interrupting the stream to demand snacks is my aesthetic.

The list, off the top of my head, includes:

  • donuts
  • cake pops
  • the time she got yelled at by Matt because she kept throwing chocolates across the table
  • The popcorn
  • the entire plate of chicken wings

And honestly, so few of these happened while she was pregnant. God I love you, Laura Bailey.

reblog.comment:

  • donuts

And honestly, so few of these happened while she was pregnant. God I love you, Laura Bailey.

summary: so... guess what i’ve been doing with my free time lately. i spent a lot more time on this than i had originally intended to,...
caption:
so… guess what i’ve been doing with my free time lately. i spent a lot more time on this than i had originally intended to, but I’m really happy with the results. if anyone wants these sims let me know and i’ll get together a cc list and their tray files.

shout out to: @wistfulpoltergeist, @peachtonium, @pyxiidis, @simandy, @imvikai, @valhallansim, @zx-ta, @shuiisims, @teanmoon, @aithsims4, @notegain, @renorasims, @saurussims, and a bunch of other cc creators who i will tag later.

title: Growth
body:
[x]

Yasha wasn’t the most perceptive, nor the smartest of their group, or even the most charismatic. The thing she was best at was smashing heads together and summoning a rage she never knew she had buried within her.
But she knew a bond when she saw one.

-

@widofjordweek

turns out, Yasha’s really fun to write for too~

I made up some stuff about marriage (idk if matt ever explained if there’s any differences in marriage between cultures but im pretending there is) so anyway, hope yall enjoy <3

summary: at the end of the campaign when the mighty nein are max level and have more money than god can they resurrect molly and just...

summary: Future CritRole things I want: someone - probably Jester, this seems like the kind of horseshit the Traveler might pull - casts...
body: Future CritRole things I want: someone - probably Jester, this seems like the kind of horseshit the Traveler might pull - casts Planar Ally. And Matt just takes a second, shuffles through some notes, says ‘have fun!’ and hands Vax'ildan’s character sheet over to Liam.

blog.name: hazelcephalopod
blog.title: Another Side of the Mirror
blog.description:
This has mostly turned into a CR blog-thing... I tag Thursday show until around Tuesday.

Hello peoples of Tumblr! This is my blog, which I make no promise to keep up with. I'm a bisexual Autistic. Also have ADD. I like cephalopods, especially cuttlefish, and plants, and reading, and many other geeky things.

More random tidbit: feminist, somewhere in the left politically, and tired of the political landscape but still trying to care. Also a lapsed pagan, it sounds like nonsense but idk how else to describe it. More things- gluten free, and crochet, knitting, and others. Beware of my many random posts as well.

That is all for now!

Oh BTW I am bad at tagging things, trying to get better, but its a work in progress.

body:
CR, ramble

So I just want to say. While I’m not certain, I’m pretty sure Wildemount, at least the empire, probably doesn’t have a very good understanding of mental health. It’s a pseudo Middle Ages esque setting, and pretty European so far. Also they’ve now mentioned several times in talks that they are playing under the assumptions that they don’t really know much about mental health and similar things. Which implies they grew up in cultures that probably also didn’t have much better of an understanding.

Which leads me to believe that the Asylum Caleb was in, for instance, probably sucked for everyone. Probably only the richest people can afford any sort of effective treatment. Also I do still want to know exactly what asylums are like -I want to know every thing Matt, plz tells us everything- but I’d guess anywhere from shitty prison, 1800’s-ish Sanitorum -basic care, ya know, humane but not really treatment per say. Fjord probably grew up in an Oliver Twist orphanage, also called an Asylum, which is not a good sign towards, anything, imo. Basically, these characters are clueless, they don’t have access to our information -and it’s not their fault- so just, maybe, consider that. Just for a moment.

Sorry I wrote this half asleep, hope I don’t sound too much like as ass.
